intro: Weinmannia magnifolia, commonly known as the magnificent weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the coastal regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive hairy texture. Weinmannia magnifolia is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline.
